Package MatrixPackage

Class MatrixMap<T>

java.lang.Object
MatrixPackage.MatrixMap<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Matrix<T>
public final class MatrixMap<T> extends Object implements Matrix<T>
This is a class representing a standard matrix with each entry consisting of an Indexes object as keys and generic T values
Author:
Vidyut Veedgav

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    (package private) static class 
    MatrixMap.InconsistentSizeException
    This is a nested Exception class to aid error handling by defining protocols for controlling Matrix sizes.
    (package private) static class 
    MatrixMap.InvalidLengthException
    This is a nested Exception class to aid error handling by defining protocols for controlling Matrix lengths.
    (package private) static class 
    MatrixMap.NonSquareException
    This a nested Exception class to aid error handling, used to check if a Matrix object represents a square matrix.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    static <S> MatrixMap<S>
    constant(int size, S value)
    Creates an instance of a MatrixMap by creating a stream of Indexes from (0, 0) to the specified int size which represents both the rows and columns of the MatrixMap, and mapping each and every Indexes object in the stream to the S value passed into the argument.
    SparseMatrixMap<T>
    convertToSparse(Ring<T> ring)
    Converts this MatrixMap to a SparseMatrixMap by creating an instance of a SparseMatrixMap and mapping each value of this MatrixMap to its counterpart.
    static <S> MatrixMap<S>
    from(S[][] matrix)
    Creates an instance of a MatrixMap by creating a stream of Indexes from (0, 0) to the length of the row and column dimentions of the two dimentional array being passed into the argument, and mapping each Indexes object to the value at the corresponding index in the argument matrix.

    getMap()
    Gets the internal Map object of the matrix.
    static <S> MatrixMap<S>
    identity(int size, S zero, S identity)
    Creates an instance of a MatrixMap by creating a stream of Indexes from (0, 0) to the specified int size which represents both the rows and columns of the MatrixMap, and mapping each Indexes object to the specified identity if it lies on the diagonal, and zero otherwise.
    static <S> MatrixMap<S>
    instance(int rows, int columns, Function<Indexes,S> valueMapper)
    Creates an instance of a MatrixMap by creating a stream of Indexes from (0, 0) to the specified rows and columns, and mapping each Indexes object in the stream to a specified value defined by the valueMapper function.

  • Method Details

    • getMap

      protected Map<Indexes,T> getMap()
      Gets the internal Map object of the matrix.
      Returns:
      An immutable copy of the matrix, which can be used for containment testing.

    • size

      public Indexes size()
      Gets the matrix size.
      Specified by:
      size in interface Matrix<T>
      Returns:
      the greatest index of the matrix, computed by the constructor upon instantiation.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the object that "textually represents" a MatrixMap.
      Specified by:
      toString in interface Matrix<T>
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a string consisting of each entry (Indexes: value)in the matrix, laid out in order top to bottom and left to right such that it accurately represents a matrix.

    • value

      public T value(Indexes indexes)
      Returns the value of this MatrixMap at the specified Indexes object in the argument.
      Specified by:
      value in interface Matrix<T>
      Parameters:
      indexes - the Indexes object containing the row and column of the desired return value.
      Returns:
      the corresponding value mapped by indexes

    • value

      public T value(int row, int column)
      Returns the value of this MatrixMap at the specified row and column in the argument.
      Parameters:
      indexes - the row and column of the desired return value in this MatrixMap.
      Returns:
      the corresponding value mapped by the index at (row, column).

    • instance

      public static <S> MatrixMap<S> instance(int rows, int columns, Function<Indexes,S> valueMapper)
      Creates an instance of a MatrixMap by creating a stream of Indexes from (0, 0) to the specified rows and columns, and mapping each Indexes object in the stream to a specified value defined by the valueMapper function.
      Type Parameters:
      S - the static type S.
      Parameters:
      rows - the number of rows the MatrixMap should have.
      columns - the number of columns the MatrixMap should have.
      valueMapper - a functional interface which uses a lambda expression to set the values of each Indexes object in the MatrixMap. The expression works as follows: ((index) -> index.rows + index.column). In this example, each index is mapped to a value representing the sum of its row and column, but it can be mapped to anything of type S.
      Returns:
      a new MatrixMap with the specified size and populated by the user defined function.
      Throws:
      MatrixMap.InvalidLengthException - a precondition is that the rows and columns in the argument must be valid.

    • instance

      public static <S> MatrixMap<S> instance(Indexes size, Function<Indexes,S> valueMapper)
      Creates an instance of a MatrixMap by creating a stream of Indexes from (0, 0) to the specified Indexes size, and mapping each Indexes object in the stream to a specified value defined by the valueMapper function.
      Type Parameters:
      S - the static type S.
      Parameters:
      size - the Indexes object containing the number of rows and columns that the MatrixMap should have.
      valueMapper - a functional interface which uses a lambda expression to set the values of each Indexes object in the MatrixMap. The expression works as follows: ((index) -> index.rows + index.column). In this example, each index is mapped to a value representing the sum of its row and column, but it can be mapped to anything of type S.
      Returns:
      a new MatrixMap with the specified size and populated by the user defined function.
      Throws:
      MatrixMap.InvalidLengthException - a precondition is that the size in the argument must be valid.

    • constant

      public static <S> MatrixMap<S> constant(int size, S value)
      Creates an instance of a MatrixMap by creating a stream of Indexes from (0, 0) to the specified int size which represents both the rows and columns of the MatrixMap, and mapping each and every Indexes object in the stream to the S value passed into the argument. This represents a constant matrix.
      Type Parameters:
      S - the static type S.
      Parameters:
      size - the integer value representing both the number of rows and columns in this MatrixMap.
      value - the value that the MatrixMap is being populated with.
      Returns:
      a new MatrixMap with the specified size and populated with the specifeid value at each index.
      Throws:
      MatrixMap.InvalidLengthException - a precondition is that the size in the argument must be valid.

    • identity

      public static <S> MatrixMap<S> identity(int size, S zero, S identity)
      Creates an instance of a MatrixMap by creating a stream of Indexes from (0, 0) to the specified int size which represents both the rows and columns of the MatrixMap, and mapping each Indexes object to the specified identity if it lies on the diagonal, and zero otherwise. This represents an identity matrix.
      Type Parameters:
      S - the static type S.
      Parameters:
      size - the integer value representing both the number of rows and columns in this MatrixMap.
      zero - the value representing zero for type S
      identity - the value representing the multiplicative identity for type S
      Returns:
      a new MatrixMap representing an identity matrix, populated with the identity along the diagonal; zero otherwise

    • from

      public static <S> MatrixMap<S> from(S[][] matrix)
      Creates an instance of a MatrixMap by creating a stream of Indexes from (0, 0) to the length of the row and column dimentions of the two dimentional array being passed into the argument, and mapping each Indexes object to the value at the corresponding index in the argument matrix.
      Type Parameters:
      S - the static type S.
      Parameters:
      matrix - the two-dimentional array that this method constructs a MatrixMap from
      Returns:
      a new MatrixMap representing the matrix in array form passed into the argument
      Throws:
      MatrixMap.InvalidLengthException - a precondition is that the length of the outer and inner arrays of matrix in the argument must be valid.

    • plus

      public MatrixMap<T> plus(Matrix<T> other, BinaryOperator<T> plus)
      Computes Matrix addition by creating a new instance of a MatrixMap, and using the specified BinaryOperator interface in the argument to apply addition between this MatrixMap and the other. One unobvious precondition is that the apply method of the BinaryOperator should model addition, perhaps using a Ring object.
      Specified by:
      plus in interface Matrix<T>
      Parameters:
      other - the other Matrix being added
      plus - the BinaryOperator interface which computes the addition of each element in the addend Matrices
      Returns:
      a new MatrixMap which is the sum of this MatrixMap and the other Matrix.
      Throws:
      MatrixMap.InconsistentSizeException - a precondition is that the two matrices being added must be of equal size.

    • times

      public MatrixMap<T> times(Matrix<T> other, Ring<T> ring)
      Computes Matrix multiplication by creating a new instance of a MatrixMap, and using the specified Ring object to compute the intermediate operations of matrix multiplication.
      Specified by:
      times in interface Matrix<T>
      Parameters:
      other - the other Matrix being multiplied.
      ring - a Ring object used for intermediate operations, further defined in the getProductAtIndex method.
      Returns:
      a new MatrixMap which is the product of this MatrixMap and the other Matrix.
      Throws:
      MatrixMap.NonSquareException - a precondition is that both factor matrices must be square matrices.
      MatrixMap.InconsistentSizeException - a precondition is that they must be of equal size.

    • convertToSparse

      public SparseMatrixMap<T> convertToSparse(Ring<T> ring)
      Converts this MatrixMap to a SparseMatrixMap by creating an instance of a SparseMatrixMap and mapping each value of this MatrixMap to its counterpart. This ensures that if this MatrixMap contains a zero, it is eliminated upon instantiation of a SparseMatrixMap.
      Parameters:
      ring - a Ring object used to represent the zero of data type T when creating a SparseMatrixMap
      Returns:
      a new SparseMatricMap containting all entries of this MatrixMap, except for mappings to zero.
